content.text: Write this number in figures
One million three hundred and two thousand five hundred and ninety-six
Two numbers are **added** together to give the number in the box immediately above
Complete the diagram
Two numbers are **multiplied** together to give the number in the box immediately above
Complete the diagram
Write these in order of size, starting with the smallest
smallest
Work out 142 as a percentage of 304
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 28 and 98
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 28 and 98
The average distance from Earth to Mars is \(2.25 \times 10^{8} \text{ km}\)
A space ship travels from Earth to Mars at an average speed of \(5.8 \times 10^{4} \text{ km/h}\)
Find how long, in hours, the journey takes
Write down the mathematical name of the shaded quadrilateral
**measure** the perimeter,
work out the area
For the shaded quadrilateral
quadrilateral \(A\),
quadrilateral \(B\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps the shaded quadrilateral onto
reflect the shaded quadrilateral in the line \(x = 1\),
enlarge the shaded quadrilateral by scale factor \(\frac{1}{2}\), centre \((- 1, 0)\)
On the grid,
Three quadrilaterals are shown on a \(1\mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Write the ratio string : woodwind : brass in its simplest form
Show that the number of violins is 27
Work out the number of cellos and the number of double basses
Cellos
Double basses   .........
The 36 string instruments are violins, cellos and double basses in the ratio
The 15 woodwind instruments are oboes, flutes and clarinets
20% of these instruments are oboes
There are twice as many flutes as clarinets
Find the number of flutes
Of the 12 brass instruments, \(\frac{1}{3}\) are trumpets, 3 are trombones and the remainder are horns
Find the number of horns
Complete the table
Find the total cost of all the instruments
The music teacher needs to buy all the instruments for the orchestra
The school is given \(65\%\) of the total cost of all the instruments
Find how much more money is needed
The music teacher at a school forms an orchestra
The instruments in the orchestra are 36 string, 15 woodwind and 12 brass
Complete the table of values for \(y = 5 + 2x - x^2\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = 5 + 2x - x^2\) for \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\)
On the grid, draw the line of symmetry
Write down the equation of the line of symmetry
Use your graph to find the solutions of the equation \(5 + 2x - x^{2} = 4.\)
On the grid, draw a line from \((- 1, 2)\) to \((1, 6)\)
Find the equation of this line in the form \(y = mx + c\)
Find the actual distance \(h\) in metres
Find the actual area of triangle \(CDE\)
A straight path crosses the play area from \(C\) to \(AB\)
It is equidistant from \(CB\) and \(CD\)
**Using a straight edge and compasses only,** construct the path
**Show all your construction arcs.**
the circumference of the pool,
the area of the pool
There is a circular pool in the play area
The pool has a diameter of \(8\mathrm{m}\)
Calculate
The scale drawing shows a play area, \(ABCDE\)
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 3 metres
Scale: 1 cm to 3 m
Complete the statements
In the diagram, \(ABC\) is a straight line
\(AD\) is parallel to \(BE\), angle \(BAD = 34^{\circ}\) and \(AB = BD\)
Work out the value of \(r\) and the value of \(s\)
r =
s =
Find the value of \(t\) and give a reason for your answer
t =   .........  because
\(q =\)  because <label>
Calculate, in km/h, the speed of the train between station \(A\) and station \(B\)
The train leaves station \(B\) at 14:40
For how many minutes did the train stop at station \(B\)?
The train travels at a constant speed between station \(B\) and station \(C\), arriving at 15:20
Complete the travel graph for the journey between station \(B\) and station \(C\)
On which part of the journey was the train travelling faster?
Between station   .........  and station
Work out how long, in hours and minutes, this journey takes
Write down the time this train arrives at station \(A\)
On the grid, show the journey of this train
Find the distance from station \(A\) when the two trains pass each other
Another train leaves station \(C\) at 12 45
It travels to station \(A\) at a constant speed of \(62\mathrm{km / h}\) without stopping at station \(B\)
The travel graph shows part of a train journey between station \(A\) and station \(C\)
Complete the frequency table
You may use the tally column to help you
Write down the mode
Work out the range
Work out the median
Calculate the mean
One of these cars is chosen at random
Find the probability that the number of people in this car is 4
Kyung records the number of people in each of 24 cars on Wednesday
His results are shown below
Kyung also records the number of people in each of 24 cars on Saturday
The table shows the results
On the grid, complete the bar chart to show these results
Write down one comparison between the frequency tables in part (a)(i) and part (b)
Work out how much Mr Razif saves if he buys a family ticket and one child ticket rather than six individual tickets
The bus leaves Singapore at 12:40 and arrives in Kuala Lumpur at 17:35
Work out, in hours and minutes, the time this journey takes
Mr Razif changes some dollars into Malaysian ringgits
He receives 318 ringgits when the exchange rate is \(1 = 4.24\) ringgits
Work out how many dollars he changes
Mr Razif travels by bus from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur with his wife and his four children
